availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas W. Kimbrough (Todd County, Kentucky, farmer and provision government convention member)

body.p: Todd County, Kentucky, farmer and provision government convention member. Virginia native. Married to Lucy T. Andrews Kimbrough in Todd County, Kentucky, on April 5, 1843. Father of Charles L. Kimbrough, Martha S. Kimbrough, and Joe N. Kimbrough. Married to Adaline Hellen Sale Kimbrough in Todd County on September 18, 1852. Father of Lucy Kimbrough, Robert Kimbrough, and Lee Kimbrough. Farmer in Todd County in 1850. Owned thirty-two enslaved persons in Todd County in 1850. Farmer in Todd County in 1860. Owned forty-one enslaved persons in Todd County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.
